We have said yellow fever is a commercial disease; and
that it prevails mostly in ports which carry on extensive
trade with tropical countries or ports. Those towns and cities
which do not carry on such commerce, are mostly exempt
from yellow fever, although in the same latitude with those
afflicted by that disease, and under the same general circumstances. To say the least, they arc exempt from the exciting
